intro: Grossularia diacantha, commonly known as the Himalayan snowberry, is a deciduous shrub native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Saxifragaceae and is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in summer. The plant produces small, bright red berries that are edible and often used in traditional medicine. Its leaves are ovate and have a slightly serrated edge, while its stems are covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Grossularia diacantha is adapted to cold climates and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky areas.
